title: Holistic Development Case Studies
description: No matter how good tech can be, it's not great if people don't understand how to use it.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal doesn't provide information on what is is going to do. It just says their company faces similar challenges to blockchain and they will use that as a case study? What will you deliver and how will it help the developer ecosystem?
f6_assessments.q1: There is no plan for what will be delivered or a time frame for delivering it. What is it you will use $20,000 for?
f6_assessments.q2: There are no deliverables or timelines thus it is not possible to audit this proposal. Nothing has been stated about how it meets the challenge of any metrics for measuring the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
Unfortunately the proposal seems to be out of the scope of the challenge. The general idea about connecting citizens to legislations could definitely bring benefits for cardano developers, but the proposal should explain this concept more specifically: what kind of legislation/connection with politician can actually bring more developers in the Cardano ecosytem? How this can simplify and encourage their work?
It would useful to indicate the part of the world considered by the proposal: legislation and political systems in relation to the blockchain are really various in the world.
In general the challenge is strictly about tooling / documentation / way to onboard new developers into the Cardano ecosystem and I can't see a real practical impact of the proposal about this.
f6_assessments.q1:
There are no indications about the team that will execute the proposal, and also in the website there is no details about the team experience. The proposal seems to be at idea-stage and it would be really good to better explain what the final product/delivery will be and how it will be realized. The budget is indicated only as an hard number without any breakdown / estimation of work hours / indication of speficic costs.
There is no indication about milestones or a roadmap for the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
As said before the definition of success is completely missing and it is not clear what will be funded through the proposal: add a clear description of the final product will help voters and CAs to better understand the project and the related deliverables, improving the auditability of the proposal.
Once defined and explained the final product it would be good to define some Key Performance Indicators that will help to track the progress of the project and will also help in the design stage of the proposal to set realistic goals.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is based on a vague problem and solution statement that does neither build a bridge to the Cardano ecosystem nor does it link directly to this challenge. Despite the fact, that this case study may help our dev ecosystem to grow, the proposer should have reflected this aspect and much more detail. With the given information I can rate impact of this proposal only with 2 stars.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no information presented about the proposer. There is no plan on how to execute this proposal. Everything is just a vague idea. This proposal seems to be in the state of ideation and needs much more details to be able to expect a high likelihood for a successful implementation. Also there is no budget breakdown, so we don't know for what the money will be spent in detail, so we can not say if the requested amount is reasonable.
f6_assessments.q2: he team didn't provide any information about how to audit its progress and success. To further improve this proposal I recommend to add a roadmap, some metrics and a reflection about risks and how to overcome them. Based on the given information this proposal is not auditable.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal problem statement seems unrelated to the challenge of creating a developer ecosystem that is inviting and supportive of developers on Cardano. 

As an entrepreneur, it's hard for me to relate to this as a serious proposal at all. Instead, it seems that the proposer is looking for funding for MyVoice as a platform, which may or may not be helpful to Catalyst and Cardano, but that is unclear from this.

As such, I must score this as a one star.
f6_assessments.q1:
Unfortunately, this proposal lacks any indication of skills in the developer ecosystem space. It would be great to see a LinkedIn, GitHub or something where we could at least see prior work in development or project management. 

There is no indication what $20,000 will be used for or what kind of timeframes will govern the project. 

In the Detailed plan it's mentioned that "we are using this as a case study" but the goal of the case study is so broad and vague that I'm at a loss as to what we are trying to accomplish with this at all, other than grabbing $20,000 from a legitimate challenge fund. 

Please take your goals for MyVoice, develop them into a consolidated vision, and come back with specific applications for the Cardano ecosystem. There is probably gold somewhere in there! 

Because of these discrepancies, I am rating this with one star.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is no clarity as to what exactly this proposal will accomplish, which leaves us with no real audibility whatsoever. 

Please clarify your goals in the next fund and structure your strategy in a realistic way that utilizes funds in a responsible way. 

For these reasons I must rate this proposal with one star.

solution: Driving innovation by taking a holistic approach to development --- both tech and big ideas…
experience: Spent last year studying and building Civic Technology to develop engagement and encourage citizens to act for the public good.
